content: 1 The Lineage Roll of Jesus Christ,— Son of David, Son of Abraham.
content_old: 1 The Lineage Roll of Jesus Christ,— Son of David, Son of Abraham.

content: 2 Abraham begat Isaac､ And Isaac begat Jacob, And Jacob begat Judah､ and his brethren;
content_old: 2 Abraham begat Isaac､ And Isaac begat Jacob, And Jacob begat Judah､ and his brethren;

content: 3 And Judah begat Perez and Zarah of Tamah､ And Perez begat Hezron, And Hezron begat Ram;
content_old: 3 And Judah begat Perez and Zarah of Tamah､ And Perez begat Hezron, And Hezron begat Ram;

content: 4 And Ram begat Amminadab､ And Amminadab begat Nashon, And Nashon begat Salmon;
content_old: 4 And Ram begat Amminadab､ And Amminadab begat Nashon, And Nashon begat Salmon;

content: 5 And Salmon begat Boaz of Rahab､ And Boaz begat Obed of Ruth, And Obed begat Jesse;
content_old: 5 And Salmon begat Boaz of Rahab､ And Boaz begat Obed of Ruth, And Obed begat Jesse;

content: 6 And Jesse begat David the King. And David begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Uriah;
content_old: 6 And Jesse begat David the King. And David begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Uriah;

content: 7 And Solomon begat Rehoboam､ And Rehoboam begat Abijah, And Abijah begat Asa;
content_old: 7 And Solomon begat Rehoboam､ And Rehoboam begat Abijah, And Abijah begat Asa;

content: 8 And Asa begat Jehoshaphat､ And Jehoshaphat begat Joram, And Joram begat Uzziah;
content_old: 8 And Asa begat Jehoshaphat､ And Jehoshaphat begat Joram, And Joram begat Uzziah;

content: 9 And Uzziah begat Jotham､ And Jotham begat Ahaz, And Ahaz begat Hezekiah:
content_old: 9 And Uzziah begat Jotham､ And Jotham begat Ahaz, And Ahaz begat Hezekiah:

content: 10 And Hezekiah begat Manasseh､ And Manasseh begat Amon, And Amon begat Josiah;
content_old: 10 And Hezekiah begat Manasseh､ And Manasseh begat Amon, And Amon begat Josiah;

content: 11 And Josiah begat Jechoniah､ and his brethren,—upon the removal to Babylon.
content_old: 11 And Josiah begat Jechoniah､ and his brethren,—upon the removal to Babylon.

content: 12 And after the removal to Babylon Jechoniah begat Shealtiel, And Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel;
content_old: 12 And after the removal to Babylon Jechoniah begat Shealtiel, And Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel;

content: 13 And Zerubbabel begat Abiud､ And Abiud begat Eliakim, And Eliakim begat Azor;
content_old: 13 And Zerubbabel begat Abiud､ And Abiud begat Eliakim, And Eliakim begat Azor;

content: 14 And Azor begat Sadoc､ And Sadoc begat Achim, And Achim begat Eliud;
content_old: 14 And Azor begat Sadoc､ And Sadoc begat Achim, And Achim begat Eliud;

content: 15 And Eliud begat Eleazar､ And Eleazar begat Matthan, And Matthan begat Jacob;—
content_old: 15 And Eliud begat Eleazar､ And Eleazar begat Matthan, And Matthan begat Jacob;—

content: 16 And Jacob begat Joseph､ the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus,—who is called Christ.
content_old: 16 And Jacob begat Joseph､ the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus,—who is called Christ.

content: 17 So then all the generations from Abraham unto David are fourteen generations, And from David unto the removal to Babylon fourteen generations; And from the removal to Babylon､ unto the Christ fourteen generations.
content_old: 17 So then all the generations from Abraham unto David are fourteen generations, And from David unto the removal to Babylon fourteen generations; And from the removal to Babylon､ unto the Christ fourteen generations.

content: 18 Now the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: His mother Mary having been betrothed to Joseph,—before they came together she was found with child by the Holy Spirit.
content_old: 18 Now the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: His mother Mary having been betrothed to Joseph,—before they came together she was found with child by the Holy Spirit.

content: 19 Moreover Joseph her husband being righteous, and yet unwilling to expose her,—intended privately to divorce her.
content_old: 19 Moreover Joseph her husband being righteous, and yet unwilling to expose her,—intended privately to divorce her.

content: 20 But when these things he had pondered lo! a messenger of the Lord by dream appeared to him､ saying,— Joseph､ son of David! do not fear to take unto thee Mary thy wife, for that which in her hath been begotten is of the Holy Spirit.
content_old: 20 But when these things he had pondered lo! a messenger of the Lord by dream appeared to him､ saying,— Joseph､ son of David! do not fear to take unto thee Mary thy wife, for that which in her hath been begotten is of the Holy Spirit.

content: 21 Moreover she shall bring forth a son､ and thou shalt call his name Jesus,—for he will save his people from their sins.
content_old: 21 Moreover she shall bring forth a son､ and thou shalt call his name Jesus,—for he will save his people from their sins.

content: 22 But all this hath come to pass､ that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord､ through the prophet､ saying:
content_old: 22 But all this hath come to pass､ that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord､ through the prophet､ saying:

content: 23 Lo! a Virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son,—and they shall call his name Emmanuel; which is､ being translated, God with us.
content_old: 23 Lo! a Virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son,—and they shall call his name Emmanuel; which is､ being translated, God with us.

content: 24 And Joseph､ awaking from his sleep, did as the messenger of the Lord directed him,—and took unto him his wife;
content_old: 24 And Joseph､ awaking from his sleep, did as the messenger of the Lord directed him,—and took unto him his wife;

content: 1 Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judæa､ in the days of Herod the king lo! wise men from eastern parts came into Jerusalem:
content_old: 1 Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judæa､ in the days of Herod the king lo! wise men from eastern parts came into Jerusalem:

content: 2 saying— Where is he that hath been born king of the Jews? for we saw his star in the east, and have come to bow down to him.
content_old: 2 saying— Where is he that hath been born king of the Jews? for we saw his star in the east, and have come to bow down to him.

content: 3 But when King Herod heard he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him;
content_old: 3 But when King Herod heard he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him;

content: 4 and assembling all the high-priests and scribes of the people he was enquiring of them— Where is the Christ to be born?
content_old: 4 and assembling all the high-priests and scribes of the people he was enquiring of them— Where is the Christ to be born?

content: 5 And they said to him､ In Bethlehem of Judæa,— for so is it written through the prophet:
content_old: 5 And they said to him､ In Bethlehem of Judæa,— for so is it written through the prophet:

content: 6 And thou､ Bethlehem､ land of Judah By no means least art thou､ among the governors of Judah,— For out of thee shall one come forth to govern, Who shall shepherd my people Israel.
content_old: 6 And thou､ Bethlehem､ land of Judah By no means least art thou､ among the governors of Judah,— For out of thee shall one come forth to govern, Who shall shepherd my people Israel.

content: 7 Then Herod privately calling the wise men, ascertained from them the time of the appearing star;
content_old: 7 Then Herod privately calling the wise men, ascertained from them the time of the appearing star;

content: 8 and sending them to Bethlehem, said— Go search out accurately concerning the child,—and as soon as ye find it bring report unto me, that I also may come and bow myself down to it.
content_old: 8 and sending them to Bethlehem, said— Go search out accurately concerning the child,—and as soon as ye find it bring report unto me, that I also may come and bow myself down to it.

content: 9 Now they､ hearing the king went, and lo! the star which they had seen in the east was going before them､ until it went and stood over where the child was;
content_old: 9 Now they､ hearing the king went, and lo! the star which they had seen in the east was going before them､ until it went and stood over where the child was;

content: 10 and､ seeing the star､ they rejoiced with exceeding great joy;
content_old: 10 and､ seeing the star､ they rejoiced with exceeding great joy;

content: 11 and､ coming into the house､ they saw the child, with Mary its mother,—and､ falling down､ prostrated themselves unto it, and､ opening their treasures､ offered unto it gifts—gold and frankincense and myrrh;
content_old: 11 and､ coming into the house､ they saw the child, with Mary its mother,—and､ falling down､ prostrated themselves unto it, and､ opening their treasures､ offered unto it gifts—gold and frankincense and myrrh;

content: 12 and being instructed by dream､ not to return unto Herod by another way retired they unto their own country.
content_old: 12 and being instructed by dream､ not to return unto Herod by another way retired they unto their own country.

content: 13 Now when they had retired lo! a messenger of the Lord appeareth by dream unto Joseph､ saying, Arise､ take unto thee the child and its mother､ and flee into Egypt, and be there､ until I tell thee,—for Herod is about to seek the child､ to destroy it.
content_old: 13 Now when they had retired lo! a messenger of the Lord appeareth by dream unto Joseph､ saying, Arise､ take unto thee the child and its mother､ and flee into Egypt, and be there､ until I tell thee,—for Herod is about to seek the child､ to destroy it.

content: 14 And he arising､ took unto him the child and its mother､ by night, and retired into Egypt;
content_old: 14 And he arising､ took unto him the child and its mother､ by night, and retired into Egypt;

content: 15 and was there､ until the death of Herod,—that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet､ saying, Out of Egypt called I my son.
content_old: 15 and was there､ until the death of Herod,—that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet､ saying, Out of Egypt called I my son.

content: 16 Then Herod seeing that he had been mocked by the wise men was exceedingly enraged,—and sent and slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem､ and in all its bounds, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had ascertained from the wise men.
content_old: 16 Then Herod seeing that he had been mocked by the wise men was exceedingly enraged,—and sent and slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem､ and in all its bounds, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had ascertained from the wise men.

content: 17 Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying:
content_old: 17 Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying:

content: 18 A voice in Ramah was heard, Weeping and great mourning,— Rachel weeping for her children､ And would not be comforted,—because they are not.
content_old: 18 A voice in Ramah was heard, Weeping and great mourning,— Rachel weeping for her children､ And would not be comforted,—because they are not.

content: 19 But when Herod was dead lo! a messenger of the Lord appeareth by dream unto Joseph in Egypt;
content_old: 19 But when Herod was dead lo! a messenger of the Lord appeareth by dream unto Joseph in Egypt;

content: 20 saying— Arise! and take unto thee the child and its mother, and be journeying into the land of Israel,—for they are dead､ who were seeking the life of the child.
content_old: 20 saying— Arise! and take unto thee the child and its mother, and be journeying into the land of Israel,—for they are dead､ who were seeking the life of the child.

content: 21 And he arising､ took unto him the child and its mother, and entered into the land of Israel.
content_old: 21 And he arising､ took unto him the child and its mother, and entered into the land of Israel.

content: 22 Hearing､ however､ that Archelaus was reigning over Judæa instead of his father Herod he was afraid thither to go,—and so､ being instructed by dream､ he retired into the parts of Galilee;
content_old: 22 Hearing､ however､ that Archelaus was reigning over Judæa instead of his father Herod he was afraid thither to go,—and so､ being instructed by dream､ he retired into the parts of Galilee;

content: 1 Now in those days came John the Immerser, proclaiming in the wilderness of Judæa;
content_old: 1 Now in those days came John the Immerser, proclaiming in the wilderness of Judæa;

content: 2 saying､ Repent ye,—for the kingdom of the heavens hath drawn near.
content_old: 2 saying､ Repent ye,—for the kingdom of the heavens hath drawn near.

content: 3 For this is he who was spoken of through Isaiah the prophet, saying､ A voice､ of one crying aloud! In the wilderness prepare ye the way of the Lord, Straight be making his paths.
content_old: 3 For this is he who was spoken of through Isaiah the prophet, saying､ A voice､ of one crying aloud! In the wilderness prepare ye the way of the Lord, Straight be making his paths.

content: 4 But John himself had his raiment of camel’s hair､ and a leathern girdle about his loins,—while his food was locusts and wild honey.
content_old: 4 But John himself had his raiment of camel’s hair､ and a leathern girdle about his loins,—while his food was locusts and wild honey.

content: 5 Then were going forth unto him—Jerusalem､ and all Judæa, and all the country round about the Jordan:
content_old: 5 Then were going forth unto him—Jerusalem､ and all Judæa, and all the country round about the Jordan:

content: 6 and were being immersed in the Jordan river､ by him, openly confessing their sins.
content_old: 6 and were being immersed in the Jordan river､ by him, openly confessing their sins.

content: 7 But seeing many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming unto his immersion he said to them,— Broods of vipers! who suggested to you, to be fleeing from the coming wrath?
content_old: 7 But seeing many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming unto his immersion he said to them,— Broods of vipers! who suggested to you, to be fleeing from the coming wrath?

content: 8 Bring forth､ therefore､ fruit worthy of repentance;
content_old: 8 Bring forth､ therefore､ fruit worthy of repentance;

content: 9 and think not to be saying within yourselves,—As our father we have Abraham; For､ I say unto you､ that God is able out of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
content_old: 9 and think not to be saying within yourselves,—As our father we have Abraham; For､ I say unto you､ that God is able out of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

content: 10 Already also the axe unto the root of the trees is being laid,—every tree､ therefore､ not bringing forth good fruit is to be hewn down, and into fire to be cast.
content_old: 10 Already also the axe unto the root of the trees is being laid,—every tree､ therefore､ not bringing forth good fruit is to be hewn down, and into fire to be cast.

content: 11 I indeed､ am immersing you in water, unto repentance,— but he who after me cometh is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to bear he will immerse you in Holy Spirit and fire:
content_old: 11 I indeed､ am immersing you in water, unto repentance,— but he who after me cometh is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to bear he will immerse you in Holy Spirit and fire:

content: 12 Whose fan is in his hand, and he will clear out his threshing-floor,—and will gather his wheat into the granary, but the chaff will he burn up with fire unquenchable.
content_old: 12 Whose fan is in his hand, and he will clear out his threshing-floor,—and will gather his wheat into the granary, but the chaff will he burn up with fire unquenchable.

content: 13 Then cometh Jesus､ from Galilee to the Jordan､ unto John,—to be immersed by him.
content_old: 13 Then cometh Jesus､ from Galilee to the Jordan､ unto John,—to be immersed by him.

content: 14 But he would have hindered him､ saying— I have need by thee to be immersed,—and dost thou come unto me?
content_old: 14 But he would have hindered him､ saying— I have need by thee to be immersed,—and dost thou come unto me?

content: 15 But Jesus answering､ said unto him, Suffer me even now,—for thus it becometh us､ to fulfil all righteousness; Then he suffered him.
content_old: 15 But Jesus answering､ said unto him, Suffer me even now,—for thus it becometh us､ to fulfil all righteousness; Then he suffered him.

content: 16 And Jesus having been immersed straightway went up from the water,—and lo! the heavens were opened and he saw the Spirit of God､ descending like a dove coming upon him;
content_old: 16 And Jesus having been immersed straightway went up from the water,—and lo! the heavens were opened and he saw the Spirit of God､ descending like a dove coming upon him;

content: 1 Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness､ by the Spirit, to be tempted by the adversary;
content_old: 1 Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness､ by the Spirit, to be tempted by the adversary;

content: 2 and､ fasting forty days and forty nights,—afterwards he hungered.
content_old: 2 and､ fasting forty days and forty nights,—afterwards he hungered.

content: 3 And､ coming near, the tempter said to him,— If thou art God’s Son speak! that these stones may become loaves.
content_old: 3 And､ coming near, the tempter said to him,— If thou art God’s Son speak! that these stones may become loaves.

content: 4 But he answering､ said, It is written,— Not on bread alone shall man live, But on every declaration coming forth through the mouth of God.
content_old: 4 But he answering､ said, It is written,— Not on bread alone shall man live, But on every declaration coming forth through the mouth of God.

content: 5 Then the adversary taketh him with him､ unto the holy city,—and he set him upon the pinnacle of the temple;
content_old: 5 Then the adversary taketh him with him､ unto the holy city,—and he set him upon the pinnacle of the temple;

content: 6 and saith to him— If thou art God’s Son cast thyself down,—for it is written, To his messengers will he give charge concerning thee; And on hands will they bear thee up, Lest once thou strike､ against a stone､ thy foot.
content_old: 6 and saith to him— If thou art God’s Son cast thyself down,—for it is written, To his messengers will he give charge concerning thee; And on hands will they bear thee up, Lest once thou strike､ against a stone､ thy foot.

content: 7 Jesus said to him, Again it is written,— Thou shalt not put to the test the Lord thy God.
content_old: 7 Jesus said to him, Again it is written,— Thou shalt not put to the test the Lord thy God.

content: 8 Again the adversary taketh him with him､ into an exceeding high mountain,—and pointeth out to him all the kingdoms of the world､ and their glory;
content_old: 8 Again the adversary taketh him with him､ into an exceeding high mountain,—and pointeth out to him all the kingdoms of the world､ and their glory;

content: 9 and said to him, All these things will I give thee,—if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
content_old: 9 and said to him, All these things will I give thee,—if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

content: 10 Then saith Jesus unto him, Withdraw､ Satan! for it is written,— The Lord thy God shalt thou worship, And to him alone render divine service.
content_old: 10 Then saith Jesus unto him, Withdraw､ Satan! for it is written,— The Lord thy God shalt thou worship, And to him alone render divine service.

content: 11 Then the adversary leaveth him,—and lo! messengers came near, and began ministering unto him.
content_old: 11 Then the adversary leaveth him,—and lo! messengers came near, and began ministering unto him.

content: 12 And hearing that John had been delivered up､ he retired into Galilee;
content_old: 12 And hearing that John had been delivered up､ he retired into Galilee;

content: 13 and､ forsaking Nazareth､ he came and fixed his dwelling in Capernaum､ which was by the lake,—within the bounds of Zebulun and Naphtali:
content_old: 13 and､ forsaking Nazareth､ he came and fixed his dwelling in Capernaum､ which was by the lake,—within the bounds of Zebulun and Naphtali:

content: 14 that it might be fulfilled､ which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying:
content_old: 14 that it might be fulfilled､ which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying:

content: 15 Land of Zebulun､ and land of Naphtali, The lake-way across the Jordan,—Galilee of the nations
content_old: 15 Land of Zebulun､ and land of Naphtali, The lake-way across the Jordan,—Galilee of the nations

content: 16 The people that was sitting in darkness A great light beheld,— And on them who were sitting in land and shade of death Light rose on them.
content_old: 16 The people that was sitting in darkness A great light beheld,— And on them who were sitting in land and shade of death Light rose on them.

content: 17 From that time began Jesus to be making proclamation, and saying,— Repent ye, for the kingdom of the heavens hath drawn near.
content_old: 17 From that time began Jesus to be making proclamation, and saying,— Repent ye, for the kingdom of the heavens hath drawn near.

content: 18 And walking round beside the sea of Galilee he saw two brethren—Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother,—casting a large fishing-net into the sea, for they were fishers;
content_old: 18 And walking round beside the sea of Galilee he saw two brethren—Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother,—casting a large fishing-net into the sea, for they were fishers;

content: 19 and he saith unto them, Come after me,— And I will make you fishers of men.
content_old: 19 and he saith unto them, Come after me,— And I will make you fishers of men.

content: 20 And they straightway leaving the nets, followed him.
content_old: 20 And they straightway leaving the nets, followed him.

content: 21 And going forward from thence he saw other two brethren—James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother—in the boat with Zebedee their father, putting in order their nets,—and he called them.
content_old: 21 And going forward from thence he saw other two brethren—James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother—in the boat with Zebedee their father, putting in order their nets,—and he called them.

content: 22 And they straightway leaving the boat and their father, followed him.
content_old: 22 And they straightway leaving the boat and their father, followed him.

content: 23 And Jesus was going round throughout all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues､ and proclaiming the glad-message of the kingdom,—and curing every disease､ and every infirmity､ among the people.
content_old: 23 And Jesus was going round throughout all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues､ and proclaiming the glad-message of the kingdom,—and curing every disease､ and every infirmity､ among the people.

content: 24 And forth went the report of him into all Syria; and they brought unto him all who were sick, with divers diseases and tortures distressed､ demonized and lunatic and paralyzed,—and he cured them.
content_old: 24 And forth went the report of him into all Syria; and they brought unto him all who were sick, with divers diseases and tortures distressed､ demonized and lunatic and paralyzed,—and he cured them.

content: 1 But seeing the multitudes he went up into a mountain,—and､ when he had taken a seat､ his disciples came unto him;
content_old: 1 But seeing the multitudes he went up into a mountain,—and､ when he had taken a seat､ his disciples came unto him;

content: 2 and､ opening his mouth､ he began teaching them, saying:—
content_old: 2 and､ opening his mouth､ he began teaching them, saying:—

content: 3 Happy the destitute in spirit; For theirs is the kingdom of the heavens:
content_old: 3 Happy the destitute in spirit; For theirs is the kingdom of the heavens:

content: 4 Happy they who mourn; For they shall be comforted:
content_old: 4 Happy they who mourn; For they shall be comforted:

content: 5 Happy the meek; For they shall inherit the earth:
content_old: 5 Happy the meek; For they shall inherit the earth:

content: 6 Happy they who hunger and thirst for righteousness; For they shall be filled:
content_old: 6 Happy they who hunger and thirst for righteousness; For they shall be filled:

content: 7 Happy the merciful; For they shall receive mercy:
content_old: 7 Happy the merciful; For they shall receive mercy:

content: 8 Happy the pure in heart; For they shall see God:
content_old: 8 Happy the pure in heart; For they shall see God:

content: 9 Happy the peacemakers; For they shall be called sons of God:
content_old: 9 Happy the peacemakers; For they shall be called sons of God:

content: 10 Happy they who have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake; For theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.
content_old: 10 Happy they who have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake; For theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.

content: 11 Happy are ye, whensoever they may reproach you and persecute you､ and say every evil thing against you falsely､ for my sake:
content_old: 11 Happy are ye, whensoever they may reproach you and persecute you､ and say every evil thing against you falsely､ for my sake:

content: 12 Rejoice and exult, because your reward is great in the heavens; for so persecuted they the prophets who were before you.
content_old: 12 Rejoice and exult, because your reward is great in the heavens; for so persecuted they the prophets who were before you.

content: 13 Ye are the salt of the earth; but if the salt become tasteless wherewith shall it be salted? it is good for nothing any more, save､ being cast out､ to be trampled on by men.
content_old: 13 Ye are the salt of the earth; but if the salt become tasteless wherewith shall it be salted? it is good for nothing any more, save､ being cast out､ to be trampled on by men.

content: 14 Ye are the light of the world: it is impossible for a city to be hid on the top of a mountain lying.
content_old: 14 Ye are the light of the world: it is impossible for a city to be hid on the top of a mountain lying.

content: 15 Neither light they a lamp､ and place it under the measure; but upon the lampstand, and it giveth light to all that are in the house.
content_old: 15 Neither light they a lamp､ and place it under the measure; but upon the lampstand, and it giveth light to all that are in the house.

content: 16 In like manner let your light shine before men,—that they may see your good works,—and glorify your Father who is in the heavens.
content_old: 16 In like manner let your light shine before men,—that they may see your good works,—and glorify your Father who is in the heavens.

content: 17 Do not think､ that I came to pull down the law, or the prophets,—I came not to pull down, but to fulfil.
content_old: 17 Do not think､ that I came to pull down the law, or the prophets,—I came not to pull down, but to fulfil.

content: 18 For verily I say unto you, until the heaven and the earth shall pass away one least letter､ or one point may in nowise pass away from the law､ till all be accomplished.
content_old: 18 For verily I say unto you, until the heaven and the earth shall pass away one least letter､ or one point may in nowise pass away from the law､ till all be accomplished.

content: 19 Whosoever､ therefore､ shall relax one of these commandments､ the least, and teach men so shall be called least in the kingdom of the heavens; but whosoever shall do and teach the same shall be called great in the kingdom of the heavens.
content_old: 19 Whosoever､ therefore､ shall relax one of these commandments､ the least, and teach men so shall be called least in the kingdom of the heavens; but whosoever shall do and teach the same shall be called great in the kingdom of the heavens.

content: 20 For I say unto you, that unless your righteousness exceed that of the Scribes and Pharisees in nowise may ye enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
content_old: 20 For I say unto you, that unless your righteousness exceed that of the Scribes and Pharisees in nowise may ye enter into the kingdom of the heavens.

content: 21 Ye have heard､ that it was said, to them of olden time,— Thou shalt not commit murder, and whosoever shall commit murder shall be liable to judgment.
content_old: 21 Ye have heard､ that it was said, to them of olden time,— Thou shalt not commit murder, and whosoever shall commit murder shall be liable to judgment.

content: 22 But I say unto you, that every one who is angry with his brother shall be liable to judgment,—and whosoever shall say to his brother､ Worthless one! shall be liable to the high council; and whosoever shall say､ Rebel! shall be liable unto the fiery gehenna.
content_old: 22 But I say unto you, that every one who is angry with his brother shall be liable to judgment,—and whosoever shall say to his brother､ Worthless one! shall be liable to the high council; and whosoever shall say､ Rebel! shall be liable unto the fiery gehenna.

content: 23 If､ therefore､ thou be bearing thy gift towards the altar, and there shouldst remember that thy brother hath aught against thee
content_old: 23 If､ therefore､ thou be bearing thy gift towards the altar, and there shouldst remember that thy brother hath aught against thee

content: 24 leave､ there､ thy gift before the altar, and withdraw,—first be reconciled unto thy brother, and then coming､ be offering thy gift.
content_old: 24 leave､ there､ thy gift before the altar, and withdraw,—first be reconciled unto thy brother, and then coming､ be offering thy gift.

content: 25 Be making agreement with thine adversary､ quickly, while thou art with him､ in the way,—lest once thine adversary deliver thee up unto the judge, and the judge､ unto the officer, and into prison thou be cast.
content_old: 25 Be making agreement with thine adversary､ quickly, while thou art with him､ in the way,—lest once thine adversary deliver thee up unto the judge, and the judge､ unto the officer, and into prison thou be cast.

content: 26 Verily I say unto thee, In nowise mayest thou come out from thence, until thou pay the last halfpenny.
content_old: 26 Verily I say unto thee, In nowise mayest thou come out from thence, until thou pay the last halfpenny.

content: 27 Ye have heard､ that it was said, Thou shalt not commit adultery:
content_old: 27 Ye have heard､ that it was said, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

content: 28 But I say unto you, that Every one who looketh on a woman so as to covet her already hath committed adultery with her､ in his heart.
content_old: 28 But I say unto you, that Every one who looketh on a woman so as to covet her already hath committed adultery with her､ in his heart.

content: 29 And if thy right eye is causing thee to stumble pluck it out､ and cast it from thee,—for it profiteth thee､ that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body be cast into gehenna.
content_old: 29 And if thy right eye is causing thee to stumble pluck it out､ and cast it from thee,—for it profiteth thee､ that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body be cast into gehenna.

content: 30 And if thy right hand is causing thee to stumble cut it off､ and cast it from thee,—for it profiteth thee､ that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body into gehenna depart.
content_old: 30 And if thy right hand is causing thee to stumble cut it off､ and cast it from thee,—for it profiteth thee､ that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body into gehenna depart.

content: 31 It was said､ moreover, Whosoever shall divorce his wife let him give her a writing of divorcement;
content_old: 31 It was said､ moreover, Whosoever shall divorce his wife let him give her a writing of divorcement;

content: 32 But I say unto you, that Everyone who divorceth his wife—saving for unfaithfulness causeth her to be made an adulteress,—and whosoever shall marry a divorced woman committeth adultery.
content_old: 32 But I say unto you, that Everyone who divorceth his wife—saving for unfaithfulness causeth her to be made an adulteress,—and whosoever shall marry a divorced woman committeth adultery.

content: 33 Again ye have heard that it was said､ to them of olden time, Thou shalt not swear falsely,— But shalt render unto the Lord､ thine oaths.
content_old: 33 Again ye have heard that it was said､ to them of olden time, Thou shalt not swear falsely,— But shalt render unto the Lord､ thine oaths.

content: 34 But I tell you—not to swear at all: Neither by heaven, because it is the throne of God,—
content_old: 34 But I tell you—not to swear at all: Neither by heaven, because it is the throne of God,—

content: 35 Nor by the earth､ because it is his footstool; Nor by Jerusalem､ because it is the city of the Great King;
content_old: 35 Nor by the earth､ because it is his footstool; Nor by Jerusalem､ because it is the city of the Great King;

content: 36 Nor by thine own head mayest thou swear, because thou art not able to make one hair white or black.
content_old: 36 Nor by thine own head mayest thou swear, because thou art not able to make one hair white or black.

content: 37 But let your word be､ Yea, yea,—Nay, nay; And what goeth beyond these is of evil.
content_old: 37 But let your word be､ Yea, yea,—Nay, nay; And what goeth beyond these is of evil.

content: 38 Ye have heard､ that it was said,— Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.
content_old: 38 Ye have heard､ that it was said,— Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.

content: 39 But I tell you, not to resist evil,— Nay whoever is smiting thee on the right cheek turn to him the other also;
content_old: 39 But I tell you, not to resist evil,— Nay whoever is smiting thee on the right cheek turn to him the other also;

content: 40 And him who is desiring thee to be judged､ and to take thy tunic let him have thy mantle also.
content_old: 40 And him who is desiring thee to be judged､ and to take thy tunic let him have thy mantle also.

content: 41 Andwhoever shall impress thee one mile go with him two:
content_old: 41 Andwhoever shall impress thee one mile go with him two:

content: 42 To him who is asking thee give; And him who is desiring from thee to borrow do not thou turn away.
content_old: 42 To him who is asking thee give; And him who is desiring from thee to borrow do not thou turn away.

content: 43 Ye have heard､ that it was said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour､ and hate thine enemy.
content_old: 43 Ye have heard､ that it was said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour､ and hate thine enemy.

content: 44 But I say unto you､ Be loving your enemies, And praying for them who are persecuting you:
content_old: 44 But I say unto you､ Be loving your enemies, And praying for them who are persecuting you:

content: 45 That ye may become sons of your Father who is in the heavens; Because his sun he maketh arise on evil and good, And sendeth rains､ on just and unjust.
content_old: 45 That ye may become sons of your Father who is in the heavens; Because his sun he maketh arise on evil and good, And sendeth rains､ on just and unjust.

content: 46 For if ye love them that love you what reward have ye? are not even the tax-collectors the same thing doing?
content_old: 46 For if ye love them that love you what reward have ye? are not even the tax-collectors the same thing doing?

content: 47 And if ye salute your brethren only what more than common are ye doing? are not even the nations the same thing doing?
content_old: 47 And if ye salute your brethren only what more than common are ye doing? are not even the nations the same thing doing?

content: 1 But take heed､ that ye do not your righteousness before men, to be gazed at by them,—otherwise at least reward have ye none､ with your Father who is in the heavens.
content_old: 1 But take heed､ that ye do not your righteousness before men, to be gazed at by them,—otherwise at least reward have ye none､ with your Father who is in the heavens.

content: 2 When､ therefore､ thou mayest be doing an alms do not sound a trumpet before thee, just as the hypocrites do､ in the synagogues and in the streets—that they may be glorified by men,—Verily I say unto you､ they are getting back their reward.
content_old: 2 When､ therefore､ thou mayest be doing an alms do not sound a trumpet before thee, just as the hypocrites do､ in the synagogues and in the streets—that they may be glorified by men,—Verily I say unto you､ they are getting back their reward.

content: 3 But thou､ when doing an alms let not thy left hand know what thy right hand is doing;
content_old: 3 But thou､ when doing an alms let not thy left hand know what thy right hand is doing;

content: 4 that thine alms may be in secret,—and thy Father､ who seeth in secret will give it back to thee.
content_old: 4 that thine alms may be in secret,—and thy Father､ who seeth in secret will give it back to thee.

content: 5 And when ye may be praying ye shall not be as the hypocrites, because they love in the synagogues､ and at the corners of the broad ways to take their stand and pray, that they may shine before men; Verily I say unto you､ they are getting back their reward.
content_old: 5 And when ye may be praying ye shall not be as the hypocrites, because they love in the synagogues､ and at the corners of the broad ways to take their stand and pray, that they may shine before men; Verily I say unto you､ they are getting back their reward.

content: 6 But thou､ when thou wouldest pray enter into thy closet, and､ fastening thy door､ pray unto thy Father who is in secret,—and thy Father who seeth in secret will reward thee.
content_old: 6 But thou､ when thou wouldest pray enter into thy closet, and､ fastening thy door､ pray unto thy Father who is in secret,—and thy Father who seeth in secret will reward thee.

content: 7 And being at prayer use not vain repetitions, just like the nations,—for they think､ that in their much speaking they shall be heard;
content_old: 7 And being at prayer use not vain repetitions, just like the nations,—for they think､ that in their much speaking they shall be heard;

content: 8 do not､ therefore､ make yourselves like them, for God your Father knoweth of what things ye have need, before ye ask him.
content_old: 8 do not､ therefore､ make yourselves like them, for God your Father knoweth of what things ye have need, before ye ask him.

content: 9 Thus therefore pray ye: Our Father､ who art in the heavens,— Hallowed be thy name,
content_old: 9 Thus therefore pray ye: Our Father､ who art in the heavens,— Hallowed be thy name,

content: 10 Come may thy kingdom,— Accomplished be thy will, as in heaven also on earth:
content_old: 10 Come may thy kingdom,— Accomplished be thy will, as in heaven also on earth:

content: 11 Our needful bread give us､ this day;
content_old: 11 Our needful bread give us､ this day;

content: 12 And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors;
content_old: 12 And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors;

content: 13 And bring us not into temptation, But rescue us from the evil one.
content_old: 13 And bring us not into temptation, But rescue us from the evil one.

content: 14 For if ye forgive men their faults Your Father who is in the heavens will forgive even you;
content_old: 14 For if ye forgive men their faults Your Father who is in the heavens will forgive even you;

content: 15 But if ye forgive not men their faults Neither will your Father forgive your faults.
content_old: 15 But if ye forgive not men their faults Neither will your Father forgive your faults.

content: 16 And when ye may be fasting become not ye､ as the hypocrites､ of sullen countenance,—for they darken their looks､ that they may appear unto men to be fasting: Verily I say unto you､ they are getting back their reward.
content_old: 16 And when ye may be fasting become not ye､ as the hypocrites､ of sullen countenance,—for they darken their looks､ that they may appear unto men to be fasting: Verily I say unto you､ they are getting back their reward.

content: 17 But when thou art fasting anoint thy head､ and thy face wash,—
content_old: 17 But when thou art fasting anoint thy head､ and thy face wash,—

content: 18 that thou do not appear unto men to be fasting, but to thy Father who is in secret,—and thy Father who seeth in secret will reward thee.
content_old: 18 that thou do not appear unto men to be fasting, but to thy Father who is in secret,—and thy Father who seeth in secret will reward thee.

content: 19 Be not laying up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust do tarnish､ and where thieves dig through and steal;
content_old: 19 Be not laying up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust do tarnish､ and where thieves dig through and steal;

content: 20 but be laying up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth tarnish､ and where thieves dig not through nor steal:
content_old: 20 but be laying up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth tarnish､ and where thieves dig not through nor steal:

content: 21 for where thy treasure is there will be thy heart also.
content_old: 21 for where thy treasure is there will be thy heart also.

content: 22 The lamp of the body is the eye: If therefore thine eye be single Thy whole body shall be lighted up;
content_old: 22 The lamp of the body is the eye: If therefore thine eye be single Thy whole body shall be lighted up;

content: 23 But if thine eye be evil Thy whole body shall be in the dark;— If therefore the light which is in thee is darkness The darkness how great!
content_old: 23 But if thine eye be evil Thy whole body shall be in the dark;— If therefore the light which is in thee is darkness The darkness how great!

content: 24 No one unto two masters can be in service; For either the one he will hate､ and the other love, Or one he will hold to､ and the other despise: Ye cannot be in service unto God and unto Riches.
content_old: 24 No one unto two masters can be in service; For either the one he will hate､ and the other love, Or one he will hold to､ and the other despise: Ye cannot be in service unto God and unto Riches.

content: 25 For this cause I say unto you: Be not anxious for your life､ What ye shall eat or what ye shall drink,— Or for your body､ What ye shall put on: Is not the life more than the food? And the body than the raiment?
content_old: 25 For this cause I say unto you: Be not anxious for your life､ What ye shall eat or what ye shall drink,— Or for your body､ What ye shall put on: Is not the life more than the food? And the body than the raiment?

content: 26 Observeintently the birds of the heaven,— That they neither sow､ nor reap､ nor gather into barns, And yet your heavenly Father feedeth them: Are not ye much better than they?
content_old: 26 Observeintently the birds of the heaven,— That they neither sow､ nor reap､ nor gather into barns, And yet your heavenly Father feedeth them: Are not ye much better than they?

content: 27 But who from among you､ being anxious､ can add to his stature one cubit?
content_old: 27 But who from among you､ being anxious､ can add to his stature one cubit?

content: 28 And about clothing why are ye anxious? Consider well the lilies of the field､ how they grow,— They toil not neither do they spin;
content_old: 28 And about clothing why are ye anxious? Consider well the lilies of the field､ how they grow,— They toil not neither do they spin;

content: 29 And yet､ I say unto you､ Not even Solomon､ in all his glory was arrayed like one of these!
content_old: 29 And yet､ I say unto you､ Not even Solomon､ in all his glory was arrayed like one of these!

content: 30 Now if the grass of the field—which to-day is､ and to-morrow into an oven is cast���God thus adorneth Not much rather you little of faith?
content_old: 30 Now if the grass of the field—which to-day is､ and to-morrow into an oven is cast���God thus adorneth Not much rather you little of faith?

content: 31 Do not then be anxious､ saying, What shall we eat? or What shall we drink? or Wherewithal shall we be arrayed?
content_old: 31 Do not then be anxious､ saying, What shall we eat? or What shall we drink? or Wherewithal shall we be arrayed?

content: 32 For all these things the nations seek after,— For your heavenly Father knoweth that ye are needing all these things.
content_old: 32 For all these things the nations seek after,— For your heavenly Father knoweth that ye are needing all these things.

content: 33 But be seeking first､ the kingdom and its righteousness,— And all these things shall be added unto you.
content_old: 33 But be seeking first､ the kingdom and its righteousness,— And all these things shall be added unto you.

content: 1 Judge not, that ye be not judged;—
content_old: 1 Judge not, that ye be not judged;—

content: 2 For with what judgment ye judge shall ye be judged,— And with what measure ye mete shall it be measured unto you.
content_old: 2 For with what judgment ye judge shall ye be judged,— And with what measure ye mete shall it be measured unto you.

content: 3 Why､ moreover､ beholdest thou the mote, in the eye of thy brother,— While the beam in thine own eye thou dost not consider?
content_old: 3 Why､ moreover､ beholdest thou the mote, in the eye of thy brother,— While the beam in thine own eye thou dost not consider?

content: 4 Or how wilt thou say unto thy brother, Let me cast the mote out of thine eye,— When lo! a beam is in thine own eye?
content_old: 4 Or how wilt thou say unto thy brother, Let me cast the mote out of thine eye,— When lo! a beam is in thine own eye?

content: 5 Hypocrite! cast first out of thine own eye the beam,— And then shalt thou see clearly to cast the mote､ out of the eye of thy brother.
content_old: 5 Hypocrite! cast first out of thine own eye the beam,— And then shalt thou see clearly to cast the mote､ out of the eye of thy brother.

content: 6 Do not give what is holy unto dogs, Neither cast ye your pearls before swine,— Lest once they trample them down with their feet, And､ turning､ tear you.
content_old: 6 Do not give what is holy unto dogs, Neither cast ye your pearls before swine,— Lest once they trample them down with their feet, And､ turning､ tear you.

content: 7 Be asking､ and it shall be given you, Be seeking､ and ye shall find,— Be knocking, and it shall be opened unto you.
content_old: 7 Be asking､ and it shall be given you, Be seeking､ and ye shall find,— Be knocking, and it shall be opened unto you.

content: 8 For whosoever asketh receiveth, And he that seeketh findeth,— And to him that knocketh shall it be opened.
content_old: 8 For whosoever asketh receiveth, And he that seeketh findeth,— And to him that knocketh shall it be opened.

content: 9 Or what man from among yourselves, Whom his son shall ask for a loaf,— A stone will give him?
content_old: 9 Or what man from among yourselves, Whom his son shall ask for a loaf,— A stone will give him?

content: 10 Or a fish also shall ask,— A serpent will give him?
content_old: 10 Or a fish also shall ask,— A serpent will give him?

content: 11 If then ye being evil know how good gifts to be giving unto your children How much more will your Father who is in the heavens give good things to them that ask him?
content_old: 11 If then ye being evil know how good gifts to be giving unto your children How much more will your Father who is in the heavens give good things to them that ask him?

content: 12 Whatsoever things､ therefore､ ye would, that men be doing unto you So be ye also doing unto them,— For this is the law and the prophets.
content_old: 12 Whatsoever things､ therefore､ ye would, that men be doing unto you So be ye also doing unto them,— For this is the law and the prophets.

content: 13 Enter ye in at the narrow gate; Because broad and roomy is the way that leadeth unto destruction,— And many are they who enter thereby:
content_old: 13 Enter ye in at the narrow gate; Because broad and roomy is the way that leadeth unto destruction,— And many are they who enter thereby:

content: 14 Because narrow is the gate､ and confined the way, that leadeth unto life,— And few are they who find it.
content_old: 14 Because narrow is the gate､ and confined the way, that leadeth unto life,— And few are they who find it.

content: 15 Beware of false prophets, Who come unto you in clothing of sheep,— While within they are ravening wolves.
content_old: 15 Beware of false prophets, Who come unto you in clothing of sheep,— While within they are ravening wolves.

content: 16 By their fruits shall ye find them out,— Unless perhaps men gather— From thorns grapes! Or from thistles figs!
content_old: 16 By their fruits shall ye find them out,— Unless perhaps men gather— From thorns grapes! Or from thistles figs!

content: 17 So every good tree fine fruit produceth,—Whereas the worthless tree evil fruit produceth:
content_old: 17 So every good tree fine fruit produceth,—Whereas the worthless tree evil fruit produceth:

content: 18 It is impossible for a good tree to be bearing evil fruit, Neither doth a worthless tree produce fine fruit.
content_old: 18 It is impossible for a good tree to be bearing evil fruit, Neither doth a worthless tree produce fine fruit.

content: 19 Every tree that beareth not fine fruit Is hewn down, and into fire is cast.
content_old: 19 Every tree that beareth not fine fruit Is hewn down, and into fire is cast.

content: 20 After all then by their fruits shall ye find them out.
content_old: 20 After all then by their fruits shall ye find them out.

content: 21 Not every one that saith unto me､ Lord! Lord! shall enter into the kingdom of the heavens,— But he that doeth the will of my Father who is in the heavens.
content_old: 21 Not every one that saith unto me､ Lord! Lord! shall enter into the kingdom of the heavens,— But he that doeth the will of my Father who is in the heavens.

content: 22 Many will say unto me､ in that day, Lord! Lord! did we not in thy name prophesy, And in thy name cast demons out,— And in thy name many works of power perform?
content_old: 22 Many will say unto me､ in that day, Lord! Lord! did we not in thy name prophesy, And in thy name cast demons out,— And in thy name many works of power perform?

content: 23 And then will I confess unto them, Never have I acknowledged you,— Depart from me､ ye workers of lawlessness!
content_old: 23 And then will I confess unto them, Never have I acknowledged you,— Depart from me､ ye workers of lawlessness!

content: 24 Every one､ therefore､ who heareth these my words, and doeth them Shall be likened to a prudent man､ who built his house upon the rock;
content_old: 24 Every one､ therefore､ who heareth these my words, and doeth them Shall be likened to a prudent man､ who built his house upon the rock;

content: 25 And the rain descended､ and the streams came､ and the winds blew, and rushed against that house, and it fell not; For it had been founded upon the rock.
content_old: 25 And the rain descended､ and the streams came､ and the winds blew, and rushed against that house, and it fell not; For it had been founded upon the rock.

content: 26 And every one who heareth these my words, and doeth them not Shall be likened unto a foolish man､ who built his house upon the sand;
content_old: 26 And every one who heareth these my words, and doeth them not Shall be likened unto a foolish man､ who built his house upon the sand;

content: 27 And the rain descended､ and the streams came､ and the winds blew, and dashed against that house, and it fell; and the fall thereof was great.
content_old: 27 And the rain descended､ and the streams came､ and the winds blew, and dashed against that house, and it fell; and the fall thereof was great.

content: 28 And it came to pass when Jesus ended these words with astonishment were the multitudes being struck at his teaching;
content_old: 28 And it came to pass when Jesus ended these words with astonishment were the multitudes being struck at his teaching;

content: 1 And when he came down from the mountain there followed him large multitudes.
content_old: 1 And when he came down from the mountain there followed him large multitudes.

content: 2 And lo! a leper coming near､ began to bow down to him､ saying,— Lord! if thou be willing thou canst cleanse me.
content_old: 2 And lo! a leper coming near､ began to bow down to him､ saying,— Lord! if thou be willing thou canst cleanse me.

content: 3 And､ stretching forth the hand､ he touched him, saying,— I am willing, be cleansed! And straightway cleansed was his leprosy.
content_old: 3 And､ stretching forth the hand､ he touched him, saying,— I am willing, be cleansed! And straightway cleansed was his leprosy.

content: 4 And Jesus saith unto him, Mind! tell no one,—but withdraw, thyself shew to the priest､ and offer the gift which Moses directed for a witness unto them.
content_old: 4 And Jesus saith unto him, Mind! tell no one,—but withdraw, thyself shew to the priest､ and offer the gift which Moses directed for a witness unto them.

content: 5 And when he entered into Capernaum there came near unto him a centurion､ beseeching him,
content_old: 5 And when he entered into Capernaum there came near unto him a centurion､ beseeching him,

content: 6 and saying､ Lord! my servant is laid prostrate in the house, a paralytic fearfully tortured.
content_old: 6 and saying､ Lord! my servant is laid prostrate in the house, a paralytic fearfully tortured.

content: 7 He saith unto him, I will come and cure him.
content_old: 7 He saith unto him, I will come and cure him.

content: 8 But the centurion､ answering､ said, Lord! I am of no consideration, that under my roof thou shouldest enter,—but only say with a word and healed shall be my servant.
content_old: 8 But the centurion､ answering､ said, Lord! I am of no consideration, that under my roof thou shouldest enter,—but only say with a word and healed shall be my servant.

content: 9 For I also am a man set under authority, having under myself､ soldiers,—and I say to this one､ Go! and he goeth, and to another, Come! and he cometh, and to my servant Do this! and he doeth it.
content_old: 9 For I also am a man set under authority, having under myself､ soldiers,—and I say to this one､ Go! and he goeth, and to another, Come! and he cometh, and to my servant Do this! and he doeth it.

content: 10 Now Jesus､ hearing､ marvelled, and said to them that followed,— Verily I say unto you､ With no one in Israel such faith as this have I found.
content_old: 10 Now Jesus､ hearing､ marvelled, and said to them that followed,— Verily I say unto you､ With no one in Israel such faith as this have I found.

content: 11 But I say unto you､ Many from east and west will have come, And shall recline with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, in the kingdom of the heavens;
content_old: 11 But I say unto you､ Many from east and west will have come, And shall recline with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, in the kingdom of the heavens;

content: 12 Whereas the sons of the kingdom shall be cast forth into the darkness outside,— There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
content_old: 12 Whereas the sons of the kingdom shall be cast forth into the darkness outside,— There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

content: 13 And Jesus said unto the centurion, Withdraw! and as thou hast believed be it done for thee. And healed was the servant in that hour.
content_old: 13 And Jesus said unto the centurion, Withdraw! and as thou hast believed be it done for thee. And healed was the servant in that hour.

content: 14 And Jesus､ coming into the house of Peter､ saw his mother-in-law laid prostrate and in a fever,
content_old: 14 And Jesus､ coming into the house of Peter､ saw his mother-in-law laid prostrate and in a fever,

content: 15 and he touched her hand, and the fever left her,—and she arose, and began ministering unto him.
content_old: 15 and he touched her hand, and the fever left her,—and she arose, and began ministering unto him.

content: 16 But､ when evening came, they brought unto him many demonized,—and he cast out the spirits with a word, and all who were sick he cured:
content_old: 16 But､ when evening came, they brought unto him many demonized,—and he cast out the spirits with a word, and all who were sick he cured:

content: 17 that it might he fulfilled､ which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,— Himself our weaknesses took, and diseases bare.
content_old: 17 that it might he fulfilled､ which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,— Himself our weaknesses took, and diseases bare.

content: 18 Now Jesus seeing a multitude about him gave orders to depart unto the other side.
content_old: 18 Now Jesus seeing a multitude about him gave orders to depart unto the other side.

content: 19 And a certain scribe､ coming near､ said unto him,— Teacher; I will follow thee, whithersoever Thou goest.
content_old: 19 And a certain scribe､ coming near､ said unto him,— Teacher; I will follow thee, whithersoever Thou goest.

content: 20 And Jesus saith unto him: The foxes have dens, And the birds of the heavens nests,— But the Son of Man hath not where his head he may recline.
content_old: 20 And Jesus saith unto him: The foxes have dens, And the birds of the heavens nests,— But the Son of Man hath not where his head he may recline.

content: 21 And another of the disciples saith unto him,— Lord! suffer me first to depart､ and bury my father.
content_old: 21 And another of the disciples saith unto him,— Lord! suffer me first to depart､ and bury my father.

content: 22 But Jesus saith unto him,— Be following me, And leave the dead to bury their own dead.
content_old: 22 But Jesus saith unto him,— Be following me, And leave the dead to bury their own dead.

content: 23 And when he entered into a boat his disciples followed him.
content_old: 23 And when he entered into a boat his disciples followed him.

content: 24 And lo! a great squall arose in the sea, so that the boat was being covered by the waves,—but he was sleeping.
content_old: 24 And lo! a great squall arose in the sea, so that the boat was being covered by the waves,—but he was sleeping.

content: 25 And､ coming near､ they aroused him､ saying, Master! save, we perish!
content_old: 25 And､ coming near､ they aroused him､ saying, Master! save, we perish!

content: 26 And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, little of faith? Then､ aroused he rebuked the winds and the sea,—and it became a great calm.
content_old: 26 And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, little of faith? Then､ aroused he rebuked the winds and the sea,—and it became a great calm.

content: 27 But the men marvelled､ saying, Whence is this one,—that both the winds and the sea unto him､ give ear?
content_old: 27 But the men marvelled､ saying, Whence is this one,—that both the winds and the sea unto him､ give ear?

content: 28 And when he came unto the other side､ into the country of the Gadarenes there met him､ two men demonized, out of the tombs coming forth,—fierce exceedingly, so that no one could pass that way;
content_old: 28 And when he came unto the other side､ into the country of the Gadarenes there met him､ two men demonized, out of the tombs coming forth,—fierce exceedingly, so that no one could pass that way;

content: 29 and lo! they cried aloud, saying､ What have we in common with thee､ O Son of God? Hast thou come hither､ before the right time to torment us?
content_old: 29 and lo! they cried aloud, saying､ What have we in common with thee､ O Son of God? Hast thou come hither､ before the right time to torment us?

content: 30 Now there was､ far from them､ a herd of many swine, feeding;
content_old: 30 Now there was､ far from them､ a herd of many swine, feeding;

content: 31 and the demons began to beseech him, saying､ If thou dost cast us out Send us away､ into the herd of swine.
content_old: 31 and the demons began to beseech him, saying､ If thou dost cast us out Send us away､ into the herd of swine.

content_old: 4 he entered into the house of God and the presence-bread did eat, which it was not allowable for him to eat､ nor for them who were with him,—save for the priests alone?

content: 6 But I say unto you,—Something greater than the temple is here!

content: 7 If､ however､ ye had known what this meaneth— Mercy I desire､ and not sacrifice Ye would not have condemned the blameless;

content: 8 For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.

content: 9 And､ passing on from thence､ he came into their synagogue;

content: 10 and lo! a man having a withered hand, and they questioned him､ saying, Is it allowable on the sabbath to heal? that they might accuse him.

content: 11 And he said unto them, What man from among yourselves shall there be,— Who shall have one sheep, And if this should fall､ on the sabbath､ into a pit Will not lay hold of it､ and raise it?
content_old: 11 And he said unto them, What man from among yourselves shall there be,— Who shall have one sheep, And if this should fall､ on the sabbath､ into a pit Will not lay hold of it､ and raise it?

content: 12 How much better､ then､ a man than a sheep? So that it is allowable on the sabbath nobly to act.

content: 20 A bruised cane will he not break, And a smoking wick will he not quench,— Until he urge on justice to victory,

content_old: 24 But the Pharisees hearing it, said, This one doth not cast out the demons, save in Beelzebul ruler of the demons.

content: 26 And if Satan is casting Satan out against himself hath he become divided,— How then shall his kingdom stand?

content: 27 And if I in Beelzebulb am casting out the demons In whom are your sons casting them out? Wherefore they shall be judges of you.
content_old: 27 And if I in Beelzebulb am casting out the demons In whom are your sons casting them out? Wherefore they shall be judges of you.

content_old: 28 But if in God’s Spirit I am casting out the demons Then doubtless hath come upon you unawares the kingdom of God!

content: 30 He that is not with me is against me,— And he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

content: 31 Wherefore I say unto you, All sin and profane speaking shall be forgiven unto men,— But the speaking profanely of the Spirit shall not be forgiven;
content_old: 31 Wherefore I say unto you, All sin and profane speaking shall be forgiven unto men,— But the speaking profanely of the Spirit shall not be forgiven;

content: 32 And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of Man it shall be forgiven him,— But whosoever shall speak against the Holy Spirit it shall not be forgiven him Either in this age, or the coming.

content: 33 Either make the tree good､ and its fruit good, Or make the tree worthless､ and its fruit worthless; For from the fruit the tree is known.

content: 34 Broods of vipers! How can ye speak good things being evil? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.

content: 35 The good man out of the good treasure putteth forth good things; And the evil man out of the evil treasure､ putteth forth evil things.

content: 40 For just as was Jonah in the belly of the sea-monster three days and three nights so will be the Son of Man､ in the heart of the earth, three days and three nights.

content: 41 Men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment､ with this generation, and will condemn it,—because they repented into the proclamation of Jonah; and lo! something greater than Jonah here.
content_old: 41 Men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment､ with this generation, and will condemn it,—because they repented into the proclamation of Jonah; and lo! something greater than Jonah here.

content: 42 The queen of the south will arise in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it,—because she came out of the ends of the earth､ to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and lo! something greater than Solomon here.

content: 43 But when the impure spirit goeth out of the man it passeth through waterless places､ seeking rest,—and findeth it not.

content_old: 44 Then it saith, Into my house will I return､ whence I came out,— and､ coming､ findeth it empty and swept and adorned.

content: 45 Then it goeth､ and taketh along with itself､ seven diverse spirits, more wicked than itself,—and､ entering､ abideth there; and the last state of that man becometh worse than the first. So shall it be, with this wicked generation.

content: 46 While yet he was speaking unto the multitudes lo! his mother and brethren were standing without, seeking to speak with him.

content: 1 On that day Jesus, going out of the house, was sitting near the sea:
content_old: 1 On that day Jesus, going out of the house, was sitting near the sea:

content: 2 and there were gathered unto him､ large multitudes, so that he into a boat entered､ and was sitting, and all the multitude on the beach was standing.

content: 3 And he spake unto them many things, in parables, saying: Lo! the sower went forth to sow,—
content_old: 3 And he spake unto them many things, in parables, saying: Lo! the sower went forth to sow,—

content: 4 and as he sowed Some indeed､ fell by the pathway, and the birds came､ and devoured it;
content_old: 4 and as he sowed Some indeed､ fell by the pathway, and the birds came､ and devoured it;

content: 5 And some fell on the rocky places, where it had not much earth,—and straightway it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth;
content_old: 5 And some fell on the rocky places, where it had not much earth,—and straightway it sprang up, because it had no depth of earth;

content: 6 and the sun arising it was scorched, and､ because it had no root､ it withered away;
content_old: 6 and the sun arising it was scorched, and､ because it had no root､ it withered away;

content: 7 And some fell upon the thorns, and the thorns came up､ and choked it;
content_old: 7 And some fell upon the thorns, and the thorns came up､ and choked it;

content: 8 But some fell upon the good ground, and did yield fruit,—this indeed a hundred fold､ and that sixty, and the other thirty.
content_old: 8 But some fell upon the good ground, and did yield fruit,—this indeed a hundred fold､ and that sixty, and the other thirty.

content: 9 He that hath ears let him hear.

content_old: 11 And he answering､ said, Because unto you hath it been given, to get to know the sacred secrets of the kingdom of the heavens,—whereas unto them hath it not been given.

content: 12 For whosoever hath it shall be given to him､ and he shall be made to abound,— But whoever hath not even what he hath shall be taken from him.
content_old: 12 For whosoever hath it shall be given to him､ and he shall be made to abound,— But whoever hath not even what he hath shall be taken from him.

content: 13 For this reason in parables､ unto them do I speak,—because seeing they see not, and hearing they hear not,—neither do they understand.
content_old: 13 For this reason in parables､ unto them do I speak,—because seeing they see not, and hearing they hear not,—neither do they understand.

content: 14 And again is being fulfilled in them the prophecy of Isaiah､ which saith,— They shall surely hear and yet will not understand, And surely see and yet not perceive;
content_old: 14 And again is being fulfilled in them the prophecy of Isaiah､ which saith,— They shall surely hear and yet will not understand, And surely see and yet not perceive;

content: 15 For the heart of this people hath become dense､ And with their ears heavily have they heard, And their eyes have they closed,— Lest, once they should see with their eyes､ And with their ears should hear, And､ with their hearts､ should understand, and return; When I would certainly heal them.
content_old: 15 For the heart of this people hath become dense､ And with their ears heavily have they heard, And their eyes have they closed,— Lest, once they should see with their eyes､ And with their ears should hear, And､ with their hearts､ should understand, and return; When I would certainly heal them.

content: 16 But happy are your eyes､ that they see, And your ears､ that they hear;
content_old: 16 But happy are your eyes､ that they see, And your ears､ that they hear;

content: 17 For verily I say unto you— Many prophets and righteous men Have coveted to see what ye see､ and have not seen, And to hear what ye hear, and have not heard.
content_old: 17 For verily I say unto you— Many prophets and righteous men Have coveted to see what ye see､ and have not seen, And to hear what ye hear, and have not heard.

content: 19 When anyone heareth the word of the kingdom､ and understandeth it not the wicked one cometh, and catcheth up that which hath been sown in his heart,—this is he by the pathway sown.
content_old: 19 When anyone heareth the word of the kingdom､ and understandeth it not the wicked one cometh, and catcheth up that which hath been sown in his heart,—this is he by the pathway sown.

content: 20 And he on the rocky places sown the same is he that heareth the word and straightway､ with joy receiveth it;
content_old: 20 And he on the rocky places sown the same is he that heareth the word and straightway､ with joy receiveth it;

content: 21 yet hath he no root in himself, but is only for a season,—and there arising､ tribulation or persecution because of the word straightway he findeth cause of stumbling.
content_old: 21 yet hath he no root in himself, but is only for a season,—and there arising､ tribulation or persecution because of the word straightway he findeth cause of stumbling.

content: 22 And he among the thorns sown the same is he that heareth the word,—and the anxiety of the age and the deceit of riches choke up the word, and unfruitful it becometh.
content_old: 22 And he among the thorns sown the same is he that heareth the word,—and the anxiety of the age and the deceit of riches choke up the word, and unfruitful it becometh.

content: 23 But he on the good ground sown the same is he who doth hear and understand the word, who､ indeed､ beareth fruit and produceth,—this a hundred､ and that sixty, and the other thirty.
content_old: 23 But he on the good ground sown the same is he who doth hear and understand the word, who､ indeed､ beareth fruit and produceth,—this a hundred､ and that sixty, and the other thirty.

content: 25 and while men were sleeping his enemy came, and sowed over darnel､ in among the wheat,—and away he went.

content: 26 And when the blade shot up､ and brought forth fruit then appeared the darnel also.

content: 27 And the servants of the householder､ coming near､ said to him,— Sir! was it not good seed thou didst sow in thy field? Whence then hath it darnel?
content_old: 27 And the servants of the householder､ coming near､ said to him,— Sir! was it not good seed thou didst sow in thy field? Whence then hath it darnel?

content: 28 And he said unto them— An enemy hath done this. And they say unto him— Wilt thou､ then､ that we go and collect it?
content_old: 28 And he said unto them— An enemy hath done this. And they say unto him— Wilt thou､ then､ that we go and collect it?

content: 29 And he saith— Nay! lest､ at any time while collecting the darnel ye uproot､ along with it､ the wheat:
content_old: 29 And he saith— Nay! lest､ at any time while collecting the darnel ye uproot､ along with it､ the wheat:

content: 30 Suffer both to grow together until the harvest､ and at harvest time I will say unto the reapers,— Collect ye first､ the darnel, and bind it into bundles､ with a view to the burning it up; but the wheat be gathering it into my barn.

content_old: 31 Anothor parable put he before them, saying— The kingdom of the heavens is like unto a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his field;

content: 32 which､ indeed､ is less than all seeds, but when grown is greater than garden-plants､ and becometh a tree,—so that the birds of heaven come､ and lodge among its branches.

content: 6 And whosoever shall cause to stumble one of these little ones who believe in me It profiteth him that there be hung a large mill-stone about his neck, and he be sunk in the wide main of the sea.

content: 7 Alas for the world! by reason of the causes of stumbling; For it is necessary that the causes of stumbling come,— Nevertheless alas for the man through whom the cause of stumbling cometh!

content: 8 But if thy hand or thy foot be causing thee to stumble Cut it off, and cast it from thee: It is seemly for thee to enter into life､ maimed or lame, Rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the age-abiding fire.

content: 9 And if thine eye causeth thee to stumble Pluck it out, and cast it from thee: It is seemly for thee one-eyed into life to enter, Rather than having two eyes to be cast into the fiery gehenna.

content: 10 Beware! do not despise one of these little ones; For I say unto you— That their messengers in the heavens do continually behold the face of my Father in the heavens.

content: 12 How to you doth it seem? If a certain man come to have a hundred sheep And one from among them go astray Will he not leave the ninety-nine upon the mountains, And going､ seek the straying one?

content_old: 19 and seeing one fig-tree by the way he came up to it, and nothing found he thereon､ save leaves only,—and he saith unto it— No more from thee let fruit spring forth､ unto times age-abiding,— and the fig-tree instantly withered away.

content: 20 And the disciples seeing it marvelled, saying— How instantly did the fig-tree wither away!
content_old: 20 And the disciples seeing it marvelled, saying— How instantly did the fig-tree wither away!

content: 21 And Jesus answering said unto them— Verily I say unto you､ If ye have faith､ and do not doubt Not only this of the fig-tree shall ye do,— But even if unto this mountain ye shall say､ Be lifted up, And be cast into the sea it shall be done.
content_old: 21 And Jesus answering said unto them— Verily I say unto you､ If ye have faith､ and do not doubt Not only this of the fig-tree shall ye do,— But even if unto this mountain ye shall say､ Be lifted up, And be cast into the sea it shall be done.

content: 22 And all things whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer､ believing ye shall receive.

content: 23 And when he entered the temple the Chief-priests and the Elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching saying､ By what authority these things art thou doing? And who to thee gave this authority?
content_old: 23 And when he entered the temple the Chief-priests and the Elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching saying､ By what authority these things art thou doing? And who to thee gave this authority?

content: 24 And making answer Jesus said unto them— I also will ask you one thing,— Which if ye tell me, I also will tell you By what authority these things I am doing:—
content_old: 24 And making answer Jesus said unto them— I also will ask you one thing,— Which if ye tell me, I also will tell you By what authority these things I am doing:—

content: 25 The immersion by John whence was it? Of heaven､ or of men? But they began to deliberate among themselves, saying— If we say､ Of heaven He will say unto us, Wherefore then did ye not believe him?

content: 26 But if we say､ Of men We fear the multitude, For all as a prophet are holding John.
content_old: 26 But if we say､ Of men We fear the multitude, For all as a prophet are holding John.

content: 27 And､ making answer to Jesus､ they said— We know not. He also said unto them— Neither do I tell you､ By what authority these things I am doing.
content_old: 27 And､ making answer to Jesus､ they said— We know not. He also said unto them— Neither do I tell you､ By what authority these things I am doing.

content: 28 But how to you doth it seem? A man had two sons: Coming unto the first he said､ Son! go thy way, To-day be working in the vineyard.

content_old: 29 And he answering､ said, I sir! and went not;

content: 30 And coming unto the second he spake in like manner,— And he answering､ said, I will not: afterwards smitten with regret､ he went.
content_old: 30 And coming unto the second he spake in like manner,— And he answering､ said, I will not: afterwards smitten with regret､ he went.

content: 31 Which of the two did the will of the father? They say, The latter. Jesus saith unto them— Verily I say unto you､ The tax-collectors and the harlots are going before you､ into the kingdom of God;
content_old: 31 Which of the two did the will of the father? They say, The latter. Jesus saith unto them— Verily I say unto you､ The tax-collectors and the harlots are going before you､ into the kingdom of God;

content: 32 For John came unto you､ in a way of righteousness, And ye believed him not,— But the tax-collectors and the harlots believed him; And ye seeing it were not even smitten with regret afterwards so as to believe him.

content: 33 Another parable hear ye:— A man there was､ a householder, Who planted a vineyard､ And a wall around it placed, And digged in it a wine-vat､ And built a tower, And let it out to husbandmen,— And left home.

content_old: 34 And when the season of fruits drew near He sent forth his servants unto the husbandmen to receive his fruits.

content: 35 And the husbandmen taking his servants, One indeed, they beat, And another slew,— And another stoned.
content_old: 35 And the husbandmen taking his servants, One indeed, they beat, And another slew,— And another stoned.

content: 37 Afterwards however､ he sent forth unto them his son, saying,— They-will pay deference unto my son!
content_old: 37 Afterwards however､ he sent forth unto them his son, saying,— They-will pay deference unto my son!

content: 38 But the husbandmen seeing the son､ said among themselves,— This is the heir: Come on! Let us slay him, And have his inheritance.

content_old: 40 When therefore the master of the vineyard shall come What will he do unto those husbandmen?

content: 41 They say unto him— Miserable men! Miserably will he destroy them; And will let out the vineyard to other husbandmen, Who will render unto him the fruits in their seasons.
content_old: 41 They say unto him— Miserable men! Miserably will he destroy them; And will let out the vineyard to other husbandmen, Who will render unto him the fruits in their seasons.

content: 42 Jesus saith unto them— Have ye never read in the Scriptures､ A stone which the builders rejected The same hath become head of the corner: From the Lord hath this come to pass, And is marvellous in our eyes.

content_old: 43 Wherefore I say unto you､ The kingdom of God will be taken away from you, And given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof:

content: 44 And he that falleth on this stone Will be sorely bruised; But on whomsoever it may fall It will utterly destroy him.
content_old: 44 And he that falleth on this stone Will be sorely bruised; But on whomsoever it may fall It will utterly destroy him.

content: 1 And answering Jesus again spake in parables unto them, saying:—

content: 3 And sent his servants､ to call the invited into the marriage-feast,— And they would not come.
content_old: 3 And sent his servants､ to call the invited into the marriage-feast,— And they would not come.

content: 4 Again sent he other servants, saying— Say to the invited､ Lo! my dinner have I prepared, Mine oxen and my fatlings are slain,— And all things are ready: Come ye into the marriage-feast.
content_old: 4 Again sent he other servants, saying— Say to the invited､ Lo! my dinner have I prepared, Mine oxen and my fatlings are slain,— And all things are ready: Come ye into the marriage-feast.

content: 5 And they slighting it､ went off, One indeed､ into his own field､ And another unto his merchandise,—
content_old: 5 And they slighting it､ went off, One indeed､ into his own field､ And another unto his merchandise,—

content: 6 And the rest securing his servants､ ill-treated and slew them.
