content: 7 And the king was provoked to anger,— And, sending his armies, Destroyed those murderers, And their city set on fire.
content_old: 7 And the king was provoked to anger,— And, sending his armies, Destroyed those murderers, And their city set on fire.

content: 8 Then saith he unto his servants— The marriage indeed､ is ready,— But the invited were not worthy;
content_old: 8 Then saith he unto his servants— The marriage indeed､ is ready,— But the invited were not worthy;

content: 9 Be going､ therefore､ into the crossways of the roads, And as many as ye shall find call ye into the marriage-feast.
content_old: 9 Be going､ therefore､ into the crossways of the roads, And as many as ye shall find call ye into the marriage-feast.

content: 10 And those servants going forth into the roads, Gathered together all whom they found, both bad and good,— And filled was the bride-chamber with guests.
content_old: 10 And those servants going forth into the roads, Gathered together all whom they found, both bad and good,— And filled was the bride-chamber with guests.

content: 11 But the king entering to view the guests Saw there a man､ who had not put on a wedding-garment,—
content_old: 11 But the king entering to view the guests Saw there a man､ who had not put on a wedding-garment,—

content_old: 12 And saith unto him— Friend! how camest thou in here, not having a wedding-garment? And he was put to silence.

content: 13 Then the king said unto the ministers— Binding him feet and hands Cast him forth into the darkness outside: There shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

content: 14 For many are called, but few chosen.

content_old: 15 Then went the Pharisees and took counsel, that they might ensnare him in discourse.

content_old: 17 Tell us then, how to thee it seemeth? Is it allowable to give tax unto Cæsar､ or not?

content_old: 21 They say—Cæsar’s. Then saith he unto them— Render､ therefore､ the things of Cæsar､ unto Cæsar,— And the things of God､ unto God.

content_old: 24 saying— Teacher! Moses said､ If any man die not having children his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

content: 1 Then Jesus spake unto the multitudes and unto his disciples,

content_old: 4 But they bind together heavy burdens､ And lay upon men’s shoulders, Whereas they with their finger are not willing to move them.

content: 5 But all their works they do､ to be gazed at by men,— For they make broad their amulets､ And make large their fringes,
content_old: 5 But all their works they do､ to be gazed at by men,— For they make broad their amulets､ And make large their fringes,

content_old: 6 And dearly love the first couch in the chief meals､ And the first seats in the synagogues,

content: 7 And the salutations in the market-places､ And to be called by men､ Rabbi.

content: 8 But ye—do not be called Rabbi,— For one is your Teacher, And all ye are brethren;
content_old: 8 But ye—do not be called Rabbi,— For one is your Teacher, And all ye are brethren;

content: 9 And father be none of you called upon the earth, For one is your Father the Heavenly;
content_old: 9 And father be none of you called upon the earth, For one is your Father the Heavenly;

content: 10 Neither be called leaders, For your leader is one the Christ;

content: 11 And the greatest of you shall be to you a minister;

content_old: 12 And whoever shall exalt himself shall be abased, And whoever shall abase himself shall be exalted

content: 14 But alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye are locking up the kingdom of the heavens before men,— For ye are not entering, Neither them who are entering suffer ye to enter.
content_old: 14 But alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye are locking up the kingdom of the heavens before men,— For ye are not entering, Neither them who are entering suffer ye to enter.

content: 15 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: Because ye compass sea and dry land､ to make one convert,— And when it is done ye make him a son of gehenna twofold more than ye.
content_old: 15 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites: Because ye compass sea and dry land､ to make one convert,— And when it is done ye make him a son of gehenna twofold more than ye.

content: 16 Alas for you､ blind guides! that say— Whosoever shall swear by the Temple it is nothing, But whosoever shall swear by the gold of the Temple is bound:
content_old: 16 Alas for you､ blind guides! that say— Whosoever shall swear by the Temple it is nothing, But whosoever shall swear by the gold of the Temple is bound:

content: 17 Foolish and blind! for which is greater, The gold､ or the Temple that hath hallowed the gold?
content_old: 17 Foolish and blind! for which is greater, The gold､ or the Temple that hath hallowed the gold?

content: 19 Blind! for which is greater The gift､ or the altar that halloweth the gift?
content_old: 19 Blind! for which is greater The gift､ or the altar that halloweth the gift?

content: 20 He therefore that hath sworn by the altar Sweareth by it､ and by all that is upon it;
content_old: 20 He therefore that hath sworn by the altar Sweareth by it､ and by all that is upon it;

content: 21 And he that hath sworn by the Temple Sweareth by it､ and by him who dwelleth therein;
content_old: 21 And he that hath sworn by the Temple Sweareth by it､ and by him who dwelleth therein;

content: 22 And he that hath sworn by heaven Sweareth by the throne of God､ and by him who sitteth thereupon.

content: 23 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye tithe the mint and the anise and the cummin,— And have dismissed the weightier matters of the law—the justice､ the mercy､ and the faith; Whereas these it was binding to do, And those not to dismiss.
content_old: 23 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye tithe the mint and the anise and the cummin,— And have dismissed the weightier matters of the law—the justice､ the mercy､ and the faith; Whereas these it was binding to do, And those not to dismiss.

content: 24 Blind guides! Straining out the gnat, But the camel swallowing.
content_old: 24 Blind guides! Straining out the gnat, But the camel swallowing.

content: 25 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish,— While within they are full of plunder and intemperance.
content_old: 25 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish,— While within they are full of plunder and intemperance.

content: 26 Blind Pharisee! cleanse first the inside of the cup and of the dish, That the outside thereof may become clean.
content_old: 26 Blind Pharisee! cleanse first the inside of the cup and of the dish, That the outside thereof may become clean.

content: 27 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye make yourselves like sepulchres whitewashed, Which outside indeed､ appear beautiful, But within are full of dead men’s bones and all uncleanness,—
content_old: 27 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye make yourselves like sepulchres whitewashed, Which outside indeed､ appear beautiful, But within are full of dead men’s bones and all uncleanness,—

content: 28 Thus ye also outside indeed､ appear to men righteous, But within are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
content_old: 28 Thus ye also outside indeed､ appear to men righteous, But within are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

content_old: 29 Alas for you､ Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites; Because ye build the sepulchres of the prophets､ And adorn the monuments of the righteous,

content_old: 30 and say— If we had been in the days of our fathers We would not have been their partners in the blood of the prophets:

content: 31 So that ye bear witness against yourselves, That ye are sons of them who murdered the prophets.

content: 32 And ye fill ye up the measure of your fathers!
content_old: 32 And ye fill ye up the measure of your fathers!

content_old: 33 Serpents! broods of vipers! how should ye flee from the judgment of gehenna?

content: 34 For this cause lo! I send unto you､ prophets and wise men and scribes,— Some from among them ye will slay and crucify, And some from among them ye will— Scourge in your synagogues､ And pursue from city to city:
content_old: 34 For this cause lo! I send unto you､ prophets and wise men and scribes,— Some from among them ye will slay and crucify, And some from among them ye will— Scourge in your synagogues､ And pursue from city to city:

content_old: 35 That there may come upon you— All righteous blood poured out upon the earth､ From the blood of Abel the righteous, Unto the blood of Zachariah､ son of Barachiah, whom ye murdered between the Temple and the altar.

content_old: 37 Jerusalem! Jerusalem! That slayeth the prophets､ And stoneth them that have been sent unto her,— How often would I have gathered thy children, Like as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings,— And ye would not!

content: 1 And Jesus coming forth from the temple was taking his departure, when his disciples came forward to point out to him the buildings of the temple.

content_old: 2 But he answering､ said unto them— Are ye not beholding all these things? Verily I say unto you— In no wise shall there be left here stone upon stone, Which shall not be thrown down.

content: 3 And as he was sitting upon the Mount of Olives the disciples came unto him､ privately, saying— Tell us､ when these things shall be,— And what the sign of thy presence､ and the conclusion of the age.
content_old: 3 And as he was sitting upon the Mount of Olives the disciples came unto him､ privately, saying— Tell us､ when these things shall be,— And what the sign of thy presence､ and the conclusion of the age.

content_old: 4 And answering Jesus said unto them— Be taking heed､ lest anyone deceive you;

content: 5 For many will come upon my name, saying— I am the Christ,— And will deceive many.
content_old: 5 For many will come upon my name, saying— I am the Christ,— And will deceive many.

content: 6 Moreover ye will be sure to be hearing of wars､ and rumours of wars: Mind! be not alarmed, for it must needs happen,— But not yet is the end;

content: 7 For there will arise— Nation against nation, And kingdom against kingdom,— And there will be famines and earthquakes in places.
content_old: 7 For there will arise— Nation against nation, And kingdom against kingdom,— And there will be famines and earthquakes in places.

content: 8 But all these things are a beginning of birth-pangs.

content_old: 35 Peter saith unto him: Even though it be needful for me with thee to die In nowise will I deny thee. Likewise all the disciples also said.

content: 36 Then Jesus cometh with them､ into a place called Gethsemane,—and he saith unto his disciples､ Sit ye here, while I go yonder and pray.

content_old: 40 And he cometh unto his disciples､ and findeth them sleeping, and said unto Peter— Thus powerless are ye one hour to watch with me?

content: 41 Be watching and praying, that ye may not enter into temptation: The spirit indeed､ is eager, but the flesh weak.
content_old: 41 Be watching and praying, that ye may not enter into temptation: The spirit indeed､ is eager, but the flesh weak.

content: 42 Again､ a second time departing he prayed, saying: My Father! If it is impossible for this to pass､ except I drink it Accomplished be thy will.

content: 54 How then should the Scriptures be fulfilled､ That thus it must need come to pass?

content: 11 Now as they were going lo! certain of the guard went into the city and reported unto the High-priests all the things that had come to pass;
content_old: 11 Now as they were going lo! certain of the guard went into the city and reported unto the High-priests all the things that had come to pass;

content: 12 and being gathered together with the Elders and taking counsel sufficient pieces of silver gave they unto the soldiers,—
content_old: 12 and being gathered together with the Elders and taking counsel sufficient pieces of silver gave they unto the soldiers,—

content: 13 saying— Say ye､ His disciples coming by night stole him while we were sleeping;
content_old: 13 saying— Say ye､ His disciples coming by night stole him while we were sleeping;

content: 14 And if this be reported unto the governor we will persuade him, and will make you free from care.
content_old: 14 And if this be reported unto the governor we will persuade him, and will make you free from care.

content: 15 And they taking the pieces of silver､ did as they were instructed. And this account was spread abroad among the Jews … until this very day.
content_old: 15 And they taking the pieces of silver､ did as they were instructed. And this account was spread abroad among the Jews … until this very day.

content: 16 And the eleven disciples went into Galilee, unto the mountain which Jesus had appointed them;
content_old: 16 And the eleven disciples went into Galilee, unto the mountain which Jesus had appointed them;

content: 17 and､ seeing him､ they worshipped, but some doubted.
content_old: 17 and､ seeing him､ they worshipped, but some doubted.

content: 18 And Jesus coming near spake unto them, saying— All authority､ in heaven and on earth､ hath been given unto me;
content_old: 18 And Jesus coming near spake unto them, saying— All authority､ in heaven and on earth､ hath been given unto me;

content: 19 Go ye､ therefore､ and disciple all the nations, Immersing them into the name of the Father､ and of the Son､ and of the Holy Spirit,—
content_old: 19 Go ye､ therefore､ and disciple all the nations, Immersing them into the name of the Father､ and of the Son､ and of the Holy Spirit,—
